discussion.content:
B. Transition Plan.

The Transition Plan is specifically designed to outline how the deliverables and benefits of the program will be handed over or transitioned into the operational environment of the organization. This includes detailing the process for releasing resources at the end of program phases or the entire program, as well as how the outputs and benefits of the program will be integrated into the organization's ongoing operations. The transition plan ensures that the value created by the program is effectively absorbed and sustained by the organization.

questions.question_text: You are the program manager of the NHQ Program for your organization. Your program is nearing the completion of one of its major phases and there are several resources that should be released at this time. What program management plan will guide you to release of the program resources and transfer the resources and benefits to operations within the organization?

discussion.content:
C. Discuss the action items and the importance of the items being completed as planned.

The conclusion of the kick-off meeting is an ideal time to summarize the key action items that have been agreed upon during the meeting. This helps to reinforce the immediate next steps and ensures that all team members and stakeholders are clear about their responsibilities and the importance of these actions for the success of the project. It's crucial to leave the meeting with a shared understanding of what needs to be done next and the significance of timely and accurate completion of these tasks.

questions.question_text: You are the project manager for the GGG Project and are about to close the project kick off meeting. All of the project team members and the key stakeholders are in attendance. What final item should you talk about before closing the meeting?

You are a program manager for your organization. You have proposed a program to the management that will last four years and will cost $35 million to create.
Management has asked to see the program charter and the proposed costs and benefits of the program.
Management agrees to your program charter and proposed to fund the program in increments at the completion of each milestone. What type of funding does management proposed for this program?

discussion.content:
B is right answer.
Step funding is a method of financing where funds are provided in stages or increments rather than as a lump sum. This approach is commonly used in projects, research, and startups to manage risk and ensure that funds are used effectively. Each stage of funding is typically tied to specific milestones or performance metrics, and subsequent funding is released only when these milestones are achieved.

The type of funding that management proposed for this program, where funding is provided at the completion of each milestone, is:

B. Step funding

Step funding involves providing funding in increments or steps, often tied to the completion of predefined project milestones. This approach allows management to review the progress of the program at each milestone and make informed decisions about continuing, modifying, or discontinuing the program based on the achieved results. It aligns funding with project progress and provides a structured way to manage financial commitments throughout the program's lifecycle.

questions.question_text: There are 1,500 doors to be installed in Tom's program. Each of the 1,500 doors is required by the building code to swing into the room rather than swing out into the hallways. It has come to Tom's attention that part of the team installing the doors has installed nearly 200 doors to swing into the hallway rather than into the rooms. Tom instructs the team to fix the problem. What type of action has Tom taken in this instance?

discussion.content:
D. Defect Repair

Defect repair involves identifying and correcting a product or component that is non-compliant with the project specifications. In this case, the doors that swing the wrong way are the defect that needs to be corrected to meet the building code requirements.

questions.question_text: A wild life protection organization opposes your program, which involves the cutting of around 200 trees to make way for the construction of a building. Which of the following correctly defines the organization in program management terminology?

discussion.content:
A. Negative Stakeholder.

In program management terminology, a negative stakeholder refers to an individual or group that is negatively impacted by the program or has a negative perception of the program. These stakeholders may oppose the program's objectives or its execution due to their interests, needs, or concerns being adversely affected. It's important to note that 'negative' does not imply that these stakeholders are bad; rather, it indicates their position or viewpoint in relation to the program's goals.
